Package com.collection.creator.autoconfigure

Class PostmanCollectionAutoConfiguration

java.lang.Object
com.collection.creator.autoconfigure.PostmanCollectionAutoConfiguration
@AutoConfiguration @ConditionalOnWebApplication @ConditionalOnClass({org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.method.annotation.RequestMappingHandlerMapping.class,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper.class}) @ConditionalOnProperty(prefix="postman.collection.generator", name="enabled", havingValue="true", matchIfMissing=true) @EnableConfigurationProperties(PostmanCollectionProperties.class) public class PostmanCollectionAutoConfiguration extends Object
Auto-configuration for Postman Collection Generator.

This configuration is automatically activated when:

  • The library is on the classpath
  • The application is a web application
  • The property postman.collection.generator.enabled is true (default)

To disable the auto-configuration, set: 

 postman.collection.generator.enabled=false

The library provides only the PostmanCollectionService bean for programmatic access. Inject the service into your own controllers or services to generate Postman collections: 

 @Autowired
 private PostmanCollectionService collectionService;

 public void generateCollection() {
     String outputPath = collectionService.generateCollection("http://localhost:8080");
 }

  • Method Details

    • objectMapper

      @Bean @ConditionalOnMissingBean public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper objectMapper()
      Create the ObjectMapper bean if not already present. This ensures Jackson is available for JSON serialization.

    • postmanCollectionService

      @Bean @ConditionalOnMissingBean public PostmanCollectionService postmanCollectionService(org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext applicationContext, PostmanCollectionProperties properties, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper objectMapper)
      Create the PostmanCollectionService bean.

      This service can be injected and used programmatically by the host application to generate Postman collections from REST endpoints.

      Example usage: 

       @Autowired
 private PostmanCollectionService collectionService;

 public String generateCollection() {
     return collectionService.generateCollection("http://localhost:8080");
 }
